title: Prince Charles commissions Holocaust survivor portraits
description: Seven survivors of the Holocaust are recorded in paintings to go on show at Buckingham Palace.

title: Ros Atkins on... Lockdown parties at No 10
description: The PM faces uproar about parties held at Downing Street when Covid-19 lockdown rules were in place.

title: Sacked belly-dancing teacher sparks Egypt debate over women's rights
description: Aya Yousef was sacked and divorced after she was filmed moving to music at a work social event.

title: I thought Dad's pig heart transplant was delirium
description: David Bennett, 57, is the first person in the world to receive a heart transplant from a genetically-modified pig.

title: Covid: PM 'can't hide from party claims' and Scotland lifts crowd rules
description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Tuesday evening.

title: Restrictions on outdoor events likely to be lifted
description: The move, which would allow Scottish football and rugby fans to return to stadiums, is expected to be confirmed later.

title: Ovo Energy sorry over advice to cuddle pets to stay warm
description: Ovo Energy, which owns SSE, says it is "embarrassed" over advice sent to its customers on how to stay warm.

title: Novak Djokovic: Questions raised over tennis star's travel declaration
description: Australian officials are investigating whether inaccurate information was given, local media says.

title: £150,000 starting salaries as firms fight for staff
description: A shortage of talent is driving up wages worldwide, says professional recruitment firm Robert Walters.

title: Man gets genetically-modified pig heart in world-first transplant
description: David Bennett, 57, is doing well three days after the experimental surgery, doctors say.

title: Djokovic visa saga 'damaging on all fronts', says ATP
description: The controversy over Novak Djokovic's visa to enter Australia has been "damaging on all fronts", says the ATP.

title: Heathrow Airport suffers 600,000 cancellations in December
description: Fresh travel restrictions sparked a wave of cancelled bookings at Britain's busiest airport.

title: Andy Zaltzman column: Jonny Bairstow breaks new ground with Sydney century
description: Andy Zaltzman digs out the eye-catching stats from the gripping draw between England and Australia in the fourth Test in Sydney.

title: FA Cup: Vote for best goal of third round
description: Watch the top picks of the goals from the FA Cup third round and vote for your favourite.

title: David Sassoli: European Parliament president dies aged 65
description: The Italian was admitted to hospital last month due to a serious complication with his immune system.

title: Covid PCR tests end for asymptomatic cases in England
description: A positive lateral flow result can now be taken as a first and final confirmation that you have Covid.

title: #NoSpendJanuary: Can it really be done?
description: Every year, the hashtag #nospendjanuary is seen on social media - but how literally do people take it?

title: Pick your England XI for fifth Ashes Test
description: Should Sam Billings make his Test debut? Is it time for Haseeb Hameed to make way? Pick your England XI for the final Ashes Test in Hobart.

title: Why I went from being an actor to a clowndoctor
description: Scots actor Carmen Pieraccini says her most rewarding role is being a clowndoctor for sick children.

title: HS2: Vast Roman settlement found by archaeologists
description: The site manager says it has the potential to transform our understanding of the Roman landscape.

title: Couple says troubled council broke family
description: A couple receive an apology and "very significant" payout from a council over a failed adoption.

title: The papers: 'Downing It Street' and pressure grows to cut isolation
description: News that people were invited to a Downing Street garden party during lockdown leads most of the papers.

title: Maya Angelou: Poet is first black woman on US quarter
description: The civil rights activist and writer is the first in a series of US women honoured on the US quarter.

title: NHS staff: 'We're doing the absolute best we can'
description: A young frontline paramedic and doctor on the pressures of omicron on their work right now.

title: HMP Styal: Prisoner who had stillborn baby 'will never forgive jail'
description: Louise Powell, 31, said she begged for an ambulance before her baby died at HMP Styal in Cheshire.

title: Kabul's markets full of food, but no-one has money
description: The UN has called for urgent aid as one million Afghan children are at risk from severe malnourishment.

title: Energy bills: 'I am already paying an extra £60 a month'
description: Some people are paying many hundreds of pounds more for domestic energy ahead of widespread price rises.

title: The controversy of wood pellets as a green energy source
description: Wood pellets are touted as a 'green' way to make electricity, but many reject these claims.

title: 'Fans had no idea what was going on' - but Gerrard refuses to blame VAR for Villa's FA Cup exit
description: Aston Villa boss Steven Gerrard accepted VAR's decision to rule out an equaliser for his side, but many watching the FA Cup defeat by Manchester United from home were left confused.
